Description: Small fragment of an ostracon from a pottery, showing two lines of hieratic on the outside of the vessel written in black ink. The sherd belonged to a closed shaped vessel, probably an amphora, it shows a greenish cream slip on the outside that was burnished partly. The inside of the vessel is coloured by a black substance which might be remains of the original content?
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 72)
